newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan wants Europe to sort out tomato paste row.
newsitem.headline: Jordan wants Europe to sort out tomato paste row.

text.p: Jordan's chief negotiator in talks on economic association with the European Union was quoted on Tuesday as saying it was up to the EU to sort out a row over tomato paste quotas that is threatening the deal.

Planning Ministry Under-Secretary Nabil Amari said Jordan had already initialled the association deal, aiming to open up trade between Jordan and the European Union, and was opposed to any renegotiation.
The agreement was initialled in April but then blocked last week when Spain protested at the size of Jordan's tomato paste quota, EU diplomats said.
Ad-Dustour newspaper quoted Amari as saying the argument was between the European Union and Spain, not Jordan.

"We signed the agreement after two and a half years of efforts. We met many difficulties," he said. "We did not expect there would be any possibility of reopening negotiations, especially after we initialled (the agreement)."
"We hope that the two sides reach agreement speedily so that we can move on to implementation."
The paper said Jordanian Foreign Minister Fayez al-Tarawnah had warned that if Europe supported Spain's objections Jordan would ask for other revisions in the agreement.
